channel.title: JMP by women in econ on Asako Mikami
channel.description: Recent content in JMP by women in econ on Asako Mikami

item.title: Yi Cheng "The Unexpected Costs of Expertise: Evidence from Highly Specialized Physicians"
item.description: This blog post is part of my “JMP by women in econ” series where I summarize and review some of the job market papers written by women PhD candidates. The papers are selected from Jennifer Doleac’s Twitter thread. I am not reading this from the perspective of an economist, let alone of a job committee member: I just like reading observational studies that tackle challenging research problems.:bowtie: I am reviewing Yi Cheng’s job market paper, “The Unexpected Costs of Expertise: Evidence from Highly Specialized Physicians.
